::: {.Exercise data-latex=""}

Écrivez les équations d’ionisation en trois étapes de l’acide phosphorique et donnez les constantes d’équilibre correspondantes. 
\vspace{\stretch{1}}

:::

::: {.Answer data-latex=""}

1. $$
\begin{split}
\ce{H3PO4 + H2O <=> H2PO4- + H3O+}
\end{split}
\qquad
\begin{split}
K_{a1} = \frac{|\ce{H2PO4-}| \cdot |\ce{H3O+}|}{|\ce{H3PO4}|} = 7.5 \cdot 10^{-3}
\end{split}
$$
2. $$
\begin{split}
\ce{H2PO4- + H2O <=> HPO4^{2-} + H3O+}
\end{split}
\qquad
\begin{split}
K_{a2} = \frac{|\ce{HPO4^{2-}}| \cdot |\ce{H3O+}|}{|\ce{H2PO4-}|} = 6.2 \cdot 10^{-8}
\end{split}
$$
3. $$
\begin{split}
\ce{HPO4^{2-} + H2O <=> PO4^{3-} + H3O+}
\end{split}
\qquad
\begin{split}
K_{a3} = \frac{|\ce{PO4^{3-}}| \cdot |\ce{H3O+}|}{|\ce{HPO4^{2-}}|} = 4.2 \cdot 10^{-13}
\end{split}
$$

:::
